lines.text: [first lines]
Excuse me.
Yes, sir?
Where are the cupcakes?
11B, sir, right over there.
Thank you.
Not at all.
How do you get along without working?
Just fine.

[laughs]
You steal from the rich to give to the poor?
No, I steal from the rich 'cause the poor have no money.
So what's the problem?
You seem to be man, we got the club here see, and here you are way over there.
Those characters over there - that's what gives motorcyling a bad name.
They ought to have their heads examined, taking choppers on a moto-cross course.
They made asses of themselves trying to burn up the course on choppers.
You guys want to watch this freak show, that's your hangup, not mine.
I mean what the hell is this?
I mean I don't gotta do nothin, you gotta do something.
Don't see many pretty girls like you hitchin' rides 'round here.
Is that a fact?
Yup. You a student?
No, I'm a teenage prostitute. Give you any ideas?
How do you feel about advice from someone who's older and who's been around a bit longer?
To be perfectly frank, I prefer it from someone younger who hasn't been around at all. Their advice is usually a lot more fun.
Ann, you know you can't possibly have any kind of permanent relationship with a guy like that.
I'm not looking for anything permanent, 'cause nothing ever is.
Beautiful you are, practical you're not.
I don't wanna be practical, I just wanna be happy. And I find that when I'm with him, I'm very happy.
For how long?
Doesn't matter. Hey, you don't pass on happiness just because it might not last. You take it while you can.
[Ann is held hostage by the Heads]

Ah, hello, my name is Miss Pig and I'm the group recreational leader here. Would you like a dip in the pool? Badminton, bowling on the green, anything you like. Don't you look lovely in your little frock? Oh, I used it for a bedspread last year, I think. Do you like my clothes? Straight from the Goodwill bag, free for nothing. Straight from the sewers, you think? Could you use me on the cover of your magazine? Well, we're just dying to hear your comments on our humble way of life, as compared to that of the fashion world.
Fuck off.
Oh, thank you very much.
[last lines]
Where we going?
I've got to get Charlie back his money, then drop you off.
And then what?
Then I gotta split for awhile.
Where?
[Shrugs]
Remember we talked about looking for something?
Yeah.
Well, I'd, I'd like to look with you. For awhile, anyway.
